commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Last, but not least, μ's third-year students. Wait a second...

commands.speaker: Nozomi
commands.line: Nico-chi isn't here yet, is she? I guess we can talk just you, me, and Eli-chi.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Okay! Eli, Nozomi, please introduce yourselves.

commands.speaker: Eli
commands.line: I'm Eli Ayase, a third-year student at Otonokizaka High. I sing in μ's and also take care of everyone's schedule.

commands.speaker: Nozomi
commands.line: I'm Nozomi Tojo. I became a school idol with my good friend Eli-chi here.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: You guys are always in sync with each other on stage, doing such acrobatic moves!

commands.speaker: Nozomi
commands.line: Eli-chi used to take ballet, so her movements are so beautiful.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: I get it now! She does always have very good posture.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: (They all have their own unique skill sets they use to be better idols.)

commands.speaker: Eli
commands.line: I heard you're the supporter for the Nijigasaki school idols. That seems like an interesting job.

commands.speaker: Nozomi
commands.line: That might be a brand new thing, having a supporter for school idols.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Yeah. We didn't plan it like that, it just kind of happened.

commands.speaker: Nozomi
commands.line: I heard how you take action and that you even went to Numazu to meet Aqours. You're incredible! You really need that kind of oomph to get something started.

commands.speaker: Eli
commands.line: Yes. Sometimes you meet someone that spurs you on to get up and do something.

commands.speaker: Nozomi
commands.line: Oh yeah, didn't you already interview the first- and second-years? Did they have anything interesting to say?

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: I got to see how they're writing lyrics and music.

commands.speaker: Eli
commands.line: You write songs for your idols too, right? Is your process anything like ours?

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: The fact that they don't really decide on a theme or anything before writing is different.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: I was surprised at first, but it was fun!

commands.speaker: Eli
commands.line: We're always looking for new ways to go about things, so that's not how we always do it.

commands.speaker: Nozomi
commands.line: We like having fun!

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: There's still a lot I don't know, but I think seeing something so different is a good experience.

commands.speaker: Nozomi
commands.line: I see! Is there anything you want to see other than how we work as idols?

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: I guess my biggest interest would be, along with your other fans, what you do in school on a regular day.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: I'd like to see what you do outside of your school idol club!

commands.speaker: Eli
commands.line: *Chuckle* I see. I don't know if our everyday lives are that interesting, but you might just get a great story out of it!

commands.speaker: Nozomi
commands.line: Do you want to come and take a look at the student council, too?

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Wait, you guys are part of the student council on top of being school idols?!

commands.speaker: Eli
commands.line: That's right. I'm the student council president and Nozomi is the vice president.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Amazing! I'd love to see that!

commands.speaker: Nico
commands.line: Excuse me.

commands.speaker: Eli
commands.line: Oh, Nico's here!

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Nico, I hope you're looking forward to the close coverage report I'm doing!

commands.speaker: Nico
commands.line: Hello, I'm Nico Yazawa!

commands.speaker: Nico
commands.line: I heard you were reporting on us, so I'm kind of nervous.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: U-Umm... Right.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: (Is Nico always like this? I thought she had more energy.)

commands.speaker: Nico
commands.line: However, I feel like there is a lot our fans can learn by seeing a day in the life of a super school idol.

commands.speaker: Eli
commands.line: Oh no, here we go again.

commands.speaker: Nozomi
commands.line: She speaks softly, but has a holier-than-thou tinge to her voice. It's just like her.

commands.speaker: Nico
commands.line: It's a little embarrassing letting everyone see us in our private lives, but I'll do my best for you because you read our articles!

commands.speaker: Nozomi
commands.line: Oh, is it over?

commands.speaker: Nico
commands.line: Nozomi, what do you mean by that?

commands.speaker: Nico
commands.line: I want everyone to know more about me, the best idol in the world...no, the universe!

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: I'll do my best to help with that!

commands.speaker: Nico
commands.line: *Giggle* This day looks like it's going to be fun!

commands.speaker: Nico
commands.line: ...It's not fun!

commands.speaker: Nozomi
commands.line: Come on, Nico-chi. There's no need to be so angry. It's just a little reporting.

commands.speaker: Nico
commands.line: This isn't what I was told! Why am I doing errands for the student council when I, super school idol Nico Yazawa, should be interviewed about my day?

commands.speaker: Eli
commands.line: She already got a good look at club activities with the first- and second-year students, so we thought this kind of everyday stuff would be a nice addition!

commands.speaker: Nico
commands.line: No, no, no! Organizing class worksheets is NOT something I do, and it's NOT something I want our fans to see!

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: I'm sorry, Nico. I just wanted everyone to see you in your daily lives.

commands.speaker: Nozomi
commands.line: What's the big deal? You shine when you help out with the student council! You look great holding worksheets, just like any super school idol!

commands.speaker: Nico
commands.line: Y-You think so?

commands.speaker: Eli
commands.line: I wanted to prepare this for the new school semester. Thanks for helping, Nico.

commands.speaker: Nico
commands.line: Well, if you needed me to help, you should have said so.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Nico, is it okay if I report on all your club lives later?

commands.speaker: Nozomi
commands.line: Haven't you already done interviews about that?

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: I haven't gotten anything on your dances or practices yet, and I want to get a good piece on the third-years, too!

commands.speaker: Nico
commands.line: That's what I like to hear! I'll get these worksheets sorted in five minutes, just you watch. Then you can report on our practice as much as you want.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: (That was an intense practice!)

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: (I thought we were working hard at Nijigasaki, but μ's' focus toward their performance is something else!)

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Eli, Nozomi, Nico. Thank you so much for today! It was a great experience!

commands.speaker: Nozomi
commands.line: We should thank you for being so passionate with your interview!

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: I'll make this into a great article! Not only that...

commands.speaker: Eli
commands.line: What else?

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: We at the Nijigasaki High School Idol Club are going to use what we learned here from you!

commands.speaker: Nico
commands.line: What?

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Uhh...

commands.speaker: Nico
commands.line: No one told me you were from the Nijigasaki High School Idol group!
